comments:
Build: 20020321
When trying to execute a launch configuration that someone else in the team has 
created, the Run/Debug button is grayed out for a reason that is hard to find: The VM_INSTALL_ID 
does not match any locally installed JRE. It is not trivial to figure out that the Environment -> JRE 
tabs must be edited.

Yes, this is problematic. VM installs are not portable. No solution currently, 
leaving open.

We will share VM names rather than install Ids. This means users need to agree 
on VM names when sharing VMs. We will report an error to the user if we cannot 
resolve a VM.

This is part of the java launching re-work.

Fixed. Replaced VM_ID with VM_NAME. The short term side effect is that configs 
that specify a VM_ID revert to using the default VM install until they are 
opened and saved in the launch config dialog.

build 20020510:
- Launches are always 'dirty' when switching between them in the launch config 
editor.
- If a project has a jar on its classpath without an associated source-jar 
(IVEHOME/lib/jclMax/osmem.jar), I get the following walk-back when trying to 
execute the launch-config:

!STACK org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[5013]:

Marco, please file a separate bug for the walkback you found.  This bug about the VM_INSTALL_ID has 
been fixed.
